text.section: The Kentucky Cooperative Extension Service shall establish and administer a pilot microprocessing program to train home-based microprocessors and personnel for supervising or giving instruction in food-handling techniques, food-protection principles, personal hygiene and plant sanitation practices, pH controls, and critical factors in acidification.

The pilot microprocessing program shall be established by August 1, 2003, and implemented no later than September 1, 2003. There shall be no less than four (4) program workshops offered to home-based microprocessors and personnel, and each shall be held in a separate and distinct geographical location within the state.

law.history: Created 2003 Ky. Acts ch. 42, sec. 5, effective June 24, 2003.
